title: Helicopter to Make Research Flight Over and Area East of Truckee, California

und.value:
A helicopter operated by Aeroquest, Ltd., of Mississauga, Canada, under contract to the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), will be making low-level flights in an area just east of Truckee, Calif., and extending north to near the Sierra/Nevada County line and south into Placer County.  The helicopter's equipment will be collecting and recording geophysical measurements.  Weather permitting, the flights will begin around June 11 and will be completed in about two weeks.

The helicopter is operated by experienced pilots who are specially trained for low-level flying.  Anyone observing the low-flying helicopter should not be alarmed when they see it fly over or pass below the horizon.

This survey is designed to remotely study geologic and hydrologic units that lie below land surface.  It is part of an ongoing USGS program to identify features such as changes in rock types ultimately providing a better understanding of the geology and hydrology of this area.  Aeroquest is working with the Federal Aviation Administration to ensure flights are in accordance with U.S. law.

Editor:  In the public interest and in accordance with Federal Aviation Administration regulations, the USGS is announcing this low-level airborne project.  Your assistance in informing the local communities is appreciated.
